reviewText: MANDINGA (1976)directed by Mario Pinzautiapprox. 90 minutesThis is a mostly pointless Italian take on American slavery.  We have a sadomasochist white woman who moves to a plantation.  In order to gain the plantation through inheritance, she begins seducing the "master" and his son.  She is sexually aroused when she sees a black man being whipped, and requests that the slave master use the whip on her.  This lets you know when you're getting in to.Most of the characters "have relations" with each other at some point in the movie.  This includes the slaves being raped.  When one of the slaves has a baby, the child goes missing and later becomes a part of the story.  This movie is ostensibly about the barbaric nature of slavery but in fact contains many racial stereotypes.  For example, the first rape scene showing a white man raping a black woman is shown as being tragic and perverted, but later a white woman throws herself at a bound black man (the two never have a word of dialogue together) and it is shown as sensual and erotic.  This is to reiterate the cliche that black men have mindless libidos and that white women secretly lust for black sexuality.  Incidentally, the black characters collectively have less than 10 minutes of speaking parts.  The second half of the movie shows scene after scene of pointless sex, including a ridiculous segment where a slave couple are tied up and "shown how to make love" by two adulterous whites.This movie came out a year after the American movie 'MANDINGO' and is clearly meant to capitalize on similar themes.  Yet this movie, despite being about interracial attitudes, doesn't "humanize" blacks or even sensationalize the subject matter in an original way.  It simply uses a risky topic as a backdrop for a movie about sex and violence - the very definition of exploitation.Unsurpringly, director Mario Pinzauti later went on to make 'PASSION PLANTATION', an installment in the "Black Emannuelle" series of "erotica".  Much of the cast of this movie also appeared in other Emmannuelle movies or SS camp exploitation titles.

reviewText: Technically, people will have problems with this film. There was some black and white fuzz that covered the screen for a few moments, the sound dubbing has much to be desired, etc... But, it did have a story that kept you moving right along. As for the sex scenes it brought to mind how brutal and irrational slavery is. Overall, I like how serious all those involved with the themes of this film played out.
summary: Not So Bad Of An Indie-Type Film
Title: Mandinga VHS

reviewerName: The Movie Guy "Movies from A to Z"
reviewText: Okay, maybe it doesn't, but one has to ask what kind of God would allow such a thing? This is the Italian version of the "B" classic "Mandingo."  It takes place in Louisiana and utilizes the same dubbing as Italian westerns, mafia, etc films. No southern accents. African-Americans sound the same as whites.In this film everyone has sex with everyone else. Slaves only have sex while standing and chained to a post. The film climaxes with a biracial foursome (two standing chained to a post) that had me scratching my head. Seriously?The film includes some minor full frontal nudity, and plenty of topless scenes as it was clearly shown as a drive-in late feature.3 stars for maximizing the nudity and the camp dubbing.
Title: Mandinga VHS

reviewText: Bad dubbing, bad acting, no character developement?  It just seemed that they just went to a park and got some African-American people and a couple of europeans and made this.  It was very cheap and very poor and to be honest that wasnt the reason I bought it!  I wanted to see an interpretation of basically what everyone knows what was going on then in "those times", but I didnt see that.  I saw a very idiotic piece of trash that I wish I could get my $2.00 back because I rented this off of Amazons direct video rental sight(which I must say is amazing and serves a need for those people who dont want to shell out 10 bucks for a crappy video) Anyway if you want to see a movie that deals with the controversy of this era I suggest watch "Goodbye Uncle Tom"  made by some more idiot Italian directors the only diffrence is they spent more money on the set designs and story developement.  Roots this could never be, In the trash can burnt is what it should be!!
summary: Appalled!  I can make a better movie about than this as a matter of fact I think I just might!!
Title: Mandinga VHS
